intro: Astragalus neoiranshahrii, commonly known as the Persian milkvetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to Iran and is characterized by its slender stems and small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant produces pods that contain several seeds, and its leaves are typically trifoliate, consisting of three small leaflets. Astragalus neoiranshahrii is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. It plays a role in soil stabilization and is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
